test_description: Verify the backend API's JWT Authentication Guard correctly validates a valid Cognito-issued JWT and rejects invalid/expired tokens.
business_risk: High - Failure could allow unauthorized access to all user data.
preconditions: Backend service is running, Cognito User Pool is configured, JWKS endpoint is available.
test_steps: 1. Obtain a valid JWT from Cognito. 2. Make a request to a protected endpoint with the valid token. 3. Make a request with an expired token. 4. Make a request with a malformed token. 5. Make a request with no token.
expected_result: Request with valid token returns 2xx. All other requests return 401 Unauthorized.
test_data_needs: Valid JWT, expired JWT, malformed JWT, protected API endpoint path.
tools_required: Supertest, Jest, AWS SDK (for generating test tokens).
environment_requirements: Integration environment with access to Cognito.
success_criteria: 100% pass rate on all validation scenarios.
failure_impact: Critical - Complete security breakdown of the API.
security_considerations: Test tokens should be for a non-privileged test user and have short expiry.
performance_expectations: Token validation should add < 20ms to the request latency.

test_description: Verify that a change made while offline is queued in IndexedDB and successfully synchronized to the server upon reconnection.
business_risk: High - Data loss for users with intermittent connectivity, undermining a key feature.
preconditions: User is logged in. Application is loaded.
test_steps: 1. Intercept network requests. 2. Go offline. 3. Perform a data-mutating action (e.g., add a history item). 4. Verify a record is created in IndexedDB. 5. Go online. 6. Verify the queued request is sent to the server. 7. Verify the IndexedDB queue is cleared. 8. Refresh page and verify data is persisted.
expected_result: Data created offline is successfully saved to the backend upon reconnection without data loss.
environment_requirements: Staging environment with full frontend and backend stack.
success_criteria: Data is synced within 10 seconds of reconnection. No data is lost.
performance_expectations: Sync process should not block UI thread.

test_description: Verify the formula execution sandbox (`isolated-vm` on Lambda) prevents access to disallowed functions, network, and filesystem.
business_risk: Critical - A sandbox escape could lead to arbitrary code execution and a full system compromise.
test_steps: 1. Invoke Lambda with a formula using `Math.random()`. 2. Invoke Lambda with a formula trying to use `require('fs')`. 3. Invoke Lambda with a formula containing an infinite loop. 4. Invoke Lambda with a valid formula (e.g., `sin(pi)`).
expected_result: Scenarios 1 & 2 fail with a security/reference error. Scenario 3 fails with a timeout error. Scenario 4 succeeds.
test_data_needs: Payloads with malicious and valid formula strings.
environment_requirements: Integration environment with deployed Lambda function.
success_criteria: 100% of disallowed actions are blocked. Valid actions succeed.
failure_impact: Critical - Potential for remote code execution (RCE).
security_considerations: Tests must be carefully crafted to probe for vulnerabilities without causing harm.
performance_expectations: Execution should complete within the 500ms P95 limit.

test_description: Verify that 95% of all GET API requests complete in under 200ms under normal load conditions.
business_risk: Medium - Slow API performance leads to a sluggish UI and poor user experience.
preconditions: Application is deployed to a production-like performance testing environment.
test_steps: 1. Define a load profile simulating 100 concurrent users browsing and using the app. 2. Run the load test for 15 minutes. 3. Monitor the P95 latency for all GET endpoints.
expected_result: The P95 latency for all GET endpoints remains below 200ms for the duration of the test.
test_data_needs: A seeded database with a realistic number of users and data points.
tools_required: JMeter or k6, New Relic or CloudWatch.
environment_requirements: Isolated performance testing environment with scalable infrastructure.
failure_impact: High - Degraded user experience, potential user churn.
security_considerations: Tests should run against a non-production environment.

test_description: Verify the main calculator view is fully compliant with WCAG 2.1 Level AA, including keyboard navigation and screen reader support.
business_risk: Medium - Non-compliance can lead to legal risk and excludes a segment of the user base.
preconditions: Application is running in a test environment.
test_steps: 1. Run an automated Axe scan on the main calculator page. 2. Manually navigate every interactive element using only the Tab key. 3. Use a screen reader (NVDA/VoiceOver) to interact with all buttons and check announcements for results/errors.
expected_result: Axe scan reports 0 critical/serious violations. All elements are focusable and operable via keyboard. Screen reader announcements are clear and accurate.
failure_impact: Medium - Poor user experience for users with disabilities, legal risk.
